description: Two days out from the first Test, cricket.com.au's Sam Ferris looks at all the big talking points on the Alinta Pitch Report
Required to stay away from teammates as Cricket Australia investigates a possible COVID-19 protocol breach, Chris Lynn smashed 69 off 44 balls including five sixes

Fresh off a duck in his first game, KFC BBL star D'Arcy Short ensured his slump was limited to that innings only as normal service resumed with a 48-ball 72 against the Adelaide Strikers at Blundstone Arena

India captain Virat Kohli was left frustrated and Aussie bat Matthew Wade relieved in the third T20I in Sydney when the tourists' referral was deemed 'null and void' after replays of the delivery appeared on the SCG big screen.

Stand-in Australia opener Matt Wade produced a scintillating 80 from 52 balls in the third T20I on Tuesday night, putting India's bowlers to the sword at the SCG.

A brilliant performance from the Indian seamers with the pink Kookaburra as Mo Shami (3-29), Jasprit Bumrah (2-33) and Navdeep Saini (3-19) starred
Twenty wickets fell on the opening day of India's day-night warm-up match against Australia  A, with the visitors taking an 86-run lead on the first innings
Shaun Marsh proved he's the most in-form and fully fit opener in Australian cricket right now, smashing seven fours and one brutal flat-batted six in his 47-ball 62 for the Melbourne Renegades
India's wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant launched six sixes and nine fours in a stunning display of striking on day two of the three-day tour match against Australia A at the SCG
Jack Wildermuth took a liking to India's bowlers on the third day of their tour match, smashing an unbeaten 111 off 119 balls.
India's No.3 Shubman Gill found the boundary 10 times before he was given out caught off Mitch Swepson's bowling in the three-day tour match against Australia A at the SCG
Entering the match with a highest first-class score of 16no, Jasprit Bumrah surprised everyone, including himself, with a rapid half-century which included two sixes

Glenn Maxwell took to the Brisbane Heat bowlers, veteran and inexperienced, as he collected a quick-fire 46 from 26 balls.

Sydney Sixers' opener Alyssa Healy hit her straps at the back end of the tournament, finishing WBBL|06 with 15 sixes and a strike rate of 161.4

Hobart Hurricanes recruit Tim David showcased his hitting power in his first outing for his new BBL club, hammering 58 from 33 deliveries at Blundstone Arena.

Australia A quick Mark Steketee came to the party in style on day three in Sydney, claiming 5-37 against the Indians in an impressive display of pace bowling
Adelaide's Rashid Khan kept his balance and, crucially, his composure, on the boundary line to collect a catch and dismiss the dangerous Colin 'Bulldozer' Ingram
A record last-wicket partnership created a few nervous moments, but the Hobart Hurricanes ultimately proved too strong for the Adelaide Strikers in their match at Blundstone Arena

There were first-class centuries for Ben McDermott and Jack Wildermuth but more worries for openers Marcus Harris and Joe Burns after they fell cheaply to Mohammed Shami  as India completed their Test preparations with a draw in Sydney
The Melbourne Renegades slumped to the second lowest total in KFC BBL history (60) as the Sydney Sixers recorded the biggest victory (by runs) ever in the competition.

Cameron Green put the finishing touches on a big ton, Mark Steketee starred with the ball and Joe Burns failed again, but the final day of the game at Drummoyne Oval was overshadowed by Will Pucovski retiring hurt after a head knock

Daniel Sams smashed a 22-ball half-century that lifted the Thunder from the jaws of defeat to a remarkable win with seven balls to spare, icing the match with four sixes off what proved the final over

Sydney Sixers batter Jordan Silk took flight on the Blundstone Arena boundary in the first game of KFC BBL10, stopping a certain six off the Hobart Hurricanes' Colin Ingram

It was short - he only made 11 runs - but Virat Kohli looked the part in his first Test on Australian soil at the MCG in 2011, playing a trademark cover drive against the spin of Nathan Lyon before edging a Ben Hilfenhaus out-swinger

India skipper Virat Kohli put his side in a strong position during their run chase with 85 off 61 balls - including four fours and three sixes - but it wasn't quite enough to ensure a Dettol T20I clean sweep over Australia at the SCG.

Entering the final over on day two on 81, Rishabh Pant threw caution to the wind to take Australia A's Jack Wildermuth for 22 runs and bring up his century in style at the SCG
Marcus Stoinis was off the mark with a six and didn't look back, racing to his third-fastest BBL fifty as he torched the Sydney Thunder at Manuka, and finished with a juggling catch off Liam Hatcher.
Melbourne Renegades wicketkeeper Sam Harper produced a bit of brilliance to run out Perth Scorchers captain Ashton Turner in their KFC BBL|10 clash at Blundstone Arena
Steve Smith paid tribute to his fallen friend Phillip Hughes in the 2014 Adelaide Test, smashing 162 against India and saluting Hughes' Test number when he brought up the milestone.
A centre-wicket practice for the Australia Test squad saw Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Nathan Lyon taking on Steve Smith, Marnus Labuschagne and Travis Head, among other battles
India's Hanuma Vihari cashed in on day two of the three-day tour match against Australia A, reaching stumps unbeaten on 104 with 13 boundaries

India batters Prithvi Shaw and Shubman Gill showed their class with a flurry of boundaries against the new pink Kookaburra ball, hammering the Australia A bowlers to all parts of the SCG on day 1 of the tour match
